poemContent:
Nobody wins on the first spin,
It usually goes round,
and later falls down, gravity does that,
but what about the kid's frown,
well it all started on a cold wet break,
'twas a mistake to partake in
this game.
Diablo.

Old fashioned wooden ones, dual
ball bearings, light-up rubber,
plastic ones, all the cool kids
glaring. Tension builds in the
year 5 playground, who can do
the most flips? Who can do the
most tricks? Accumulating scratches,
exhilirating.

Thrown up into the air, catching
it on one stick, until it hits
the wet gravel floor,
fun in something so basic.

Muscle memory ingrained for life,
recovered from the closet.
I remember competitions only concluded by
the scream of the whistle. Yet I
am rusty now.
Oh what fun we had on the year 5 playground.
